testcase.brief: PMTUD is work in different TOPO2
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
Test Procedure: 1. Setup L3VPN in BR1 and CVG 2. Setup L3VPN in BR2 and CVG 3. Enable TCP MSS as auto in all device. 4. Connect one laptop to BR1 5. Connect another laptop to BR2 6. Send TCP traffic from BR1 to BR2 by l3vpn, result 1. 7. Send TCP traffic from BR1 to CVG by l3vpn, result 1. 8. Send TCP traffic from BR2 to CVG by l3vpn, result 1.

step.desc: config CVG act as l3 VPN server
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ee-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_cert.pem" -v "save vpn private-key tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_key.pem" -v "vpn xauth-client-list list_01 local" -v "vpn xauth-client-list list_01 client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn server-ipsec-tunnel ${cvg1.tunnel.name} vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${cvg1.tunnel.name} client-list list_01" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_policy_01 server ipsec-tunnel ${cvg1.tunnel.name}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}"
-v "routing protocol ospf advertise eth1" -v "routing protocol ospf router-id ${cvg1.cvg.lan.ip}" -v "routing protocol type ospf" -v "routing protocol enable"

step.desc: config ${br1.br.name} as l3 VPN client connet to CVG
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "save vpn ca-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/cacert.pem" -v "vpn client-ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} gateway ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_policy_01 client ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} primary" -v "" -v "routing route-request enable" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v ""

step.desc: config ${br2.br.name} as l3 VPN client connet to CVG
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "save vpn ca-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/cacert.pem" -v "vpn client-ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} gateway ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_policy_01 client ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} primary" -v "" -v "routing route-request enable" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v ""

step.desc: check vpn ike sa on BR1 side destination to CVG public address
check vpn ike sa on BR2 side destination to CVG public address
check vpn ike sa on CVG side destionation to BR public address
check gre tunnel on br1 side remote to CVG wan address, local mgt0 address ,gateway CVG public address
check gre tunnel on br2 side remote to CVG wan address, local mgt0 address ,gateway CVG public address
check gre tunnel on cvg side local to CVG wan address
config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable on BR1
step.telnet: -v "vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: Set interface eth1 to access mode and enable mac-learning no BR1
step.telnet: -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport user-profile-attribute 1"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
config mgt0.2 with dhcp service enable on BR2
step.telnet: -v "vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: Set interface eth1 to access mode and enable mac-learning
step.telnet: -v "vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc2.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport user-profile-attribute 1"

step.desc: br2.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.2
set br2.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side

step.telnet: -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 6 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "clear log all"
-v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${br2.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 6 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "clear log all"

step.ssh: -v "dd if=/dev/zero of=${create.file_2} bs=100K count=1" -v "chmod 777 ${create.file_2}" -v "service vsftpd restart"

step.desc: send TCP traffic that go through l3vpn from BR1 to br2.vpc1

step.log-match: -re -e "(set tcp mss to 1358 sucessfully|TCP syn pkt, try to clamp tcp mss to 1358|TCPMSS.*: ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}:\d+->${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip}:\d+ changed TCP MSS option \(from 1460 to 1358\))"

step.ssh: -v "dd if=/dev/zero of=${create.file} bs=100K count=1" -v "chmod 777 ${create.file}" -v "service vsftpd restart"

step.desc: send TCP traffic that go through l3vpn from BR to CVG

step.log-match: -re -e "(set tcp mss to 1358 sucessfully|TCP syn pkt, try to clamp tcp mss to 1358|TCPMSS.*: ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}:\d+->${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip}:\d+ changed TCP MSS option \(from 1460 to 1358\))"

step.desc: send TCP traffic that go through l3vpn from BR to CVG

step.log-match: -re -e "(set tcp mss to 1358 sucessfully|TCP syn pkt, try to clamp tcp mss to 1358|TCPMSS.*: ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}:\d+->${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip}:\d+ changed TCP MSS option \(from 1460 to 1358\))"
